abstract: Editorial criticizes Pres Obama's jobs council for listening to special interests and asking Congress to end safeguards of Sarbanes-Oxley Act; says watering down the antifraud law passed in response to Enron, WorldCom and dot-com bust has long been a goal of corporate America despite studies showing that law has reduced errors and fraud.
snippet: President Obama’s jobs council shouldn’t be advocating for special interests by asking Congress to end safeguards of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act.
lead_paragraph: President Obama’s jobs council shouldn’t be advocating for special interests by asking Congress to end safeguards of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act.
